newsitem.title: UK: Euro oil swaps react differently to crude drop.
newsitem.headline: Euro oil swaps react differently to crude drop.

text.p: European oil swaps showed wildly mixed reactions to screen crude's correction of Thursday's mini-rally.
Brent CFDs were several cents firmer while gasoline tumbled heavily, losing $6/7 on the front month. Naphtha softened $1 close in, but was firmer further out while fuel held broadly steady.

Brent CFDs for July 21-25 firmed to +11 cents against September Brent from +3/4 cents and July 28-August 1 was stronger at -3 cents from -7 cents. August 4-8 rose to -2 cents against September from -10 cents and August 11-15 firmed 3 cents or so to -10 cents.
Gasoline swaps were hit hard in light of the product's recent primary role as driver for the whole energy complex.
"Gasoline gave and gasoline took-away," said one trader.
Wet barges trades in the morning at $191, $193 and $193.50 were unobtainable in the afternoon and the swaps market reflected this reversal.
August was talked at $186.75 from $193.25 while September eased back to $185.50 from $191. There was unconfirmed talk that September traded at $189.00 and July at $193.50.
Fuel swaps which edged up on the gains slipped again with July holding around $88-88.50 on high sulphur with August at $89.00.
Further out Q4 traded at $94 and Q198 at $97.00 and $98.00.
Low sulphur traded a couple of times at $100.50 and subsequently offered at $101.
